story.label: Our Story
story.title: Born from a Simple Truth
story.text1: Italy holds some of the world's most remarkable venues, places where history lives in every stone and celebrations feel eternal. Yet many of these venues remain hidden from international clients, lacking the infrastructure to reach beyond Italy's borders.
story.text2: Aeterna Events was founded to close this gap. We combine deep local knowledge with international understanding, connecting clients worldwide with venues that would otherwise remain undiscovered. No contracted lists, no commissions that influence our recommendations, just honest guidance toward places that deserve to be known.
story.text3: The name "Aeterna" is Latin for "eternal," reflecting both Italy's timeless heritage and our belief that the right venue creates memories that last beyond any single celebration.

items.question: How does your service work?
items.answer: After you reach out, we'll schedule a call to understand your vision, requirements, and budget. We then search our network of Italian venues and present you with a curated selection. Once you choose, we help coordinate the booking process.

items.question: What does the venue finding service cost?
items.answer: Our venue finding service is free if you book through us. We receive a commission from the venue, which doesn't affect the price you pay. If you use our research but book independently, a flat consultation fee applies.

items.question: How far in advance should I start?
items.answer: For weddings, we recommend starting 12-18 months ahead, especially for popular regions and dates. Corporate retreats typically need 3-6 months lead time, though we can work with shorter timelines when needed.

items.question: Do you only work with venues in certain regions?
items.answer: We have connections across all of Italy, from the northern lakes to Sicily. While we have particularly strong networks in Tuscany, Umbria, Puglia, and the Amalfi Coast, we can search any region based on your preferences.

items.question: Do you provide full event planning?
items.answer: Our core service is venue finding. Once you've secured your venue, we can recommend trusted local planners, caterers, and vendors if you need full event coordination. Many venues also offer their own event management services.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.content:
Aeterna Events ("we," "us," or "our") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your personal data when you visit our website or use our services, in accordance with the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and Italian data protection laws.

1. Data Controller

The data controller responsible for your personal data is:

Aeterna Events
Email: hello@aeternaevents.com
P.IVA: 00000000000

For any questions regarding this Privacy Policy or your personal data, please contact us at the email address above.

2. Personal Data We Collect

We collect personal data that you voluntarily provide to us when you:

  • Fill out our contact form
  • Send us an email
  • Request information about our services

Categories of personal data collected:

  • Contact information: Name, email address
  • Event details: Event type (corporate retreat, wedding, other), estimated guest count, preferred dates, preferred region in Italy
  • Communication content: Messages and inquiries you send us
  • Technical data: IP address, browser type, and device information (collected automatically through cookies)

3. Purpose of Processing

We process your personal data for the following purposes:

  • To respond to your inquiries: When you contact us through our form or email, we use your data to respond and provide information about our services.
  • To provide our services: If you engage us for venue finding, we use your event details to search for and recommend suitable venues.
  • To improve our website: We use technical data to understand how visitors use our website and improve user experience.
  • To comply with legal obligations: We may process your data when required by law.

4. Legal Basis for Processing

We process your personal data based on the following legal grounds under GDPR Article 6:

  • Consent (Art. 6(1)(a)): When you submit our contact form, you provide explicit consent to the processing of your data by checking the consent checkbox.
  • Legitimate interests (Art. 6(1)(f)): We have a legitimate interest in responding to inquiries and improving our services.
  • Legal obligation (Art. 6(1)(c)): We may process data to comply with legal requirements.

5. Third-Party Data Processors

We share your personal data with the following third-party service providers who process data on our behalf:

Formspree

Our contact form submissions are processed by Formspree, Inc. Formspree acts as a data processor and handles form submissions securely. When you submit our contact form, your data is transmitted to Formspree's servers in the United States. Formspree complies with applicable data protection regulations.

For more information, see Formspree's Privacy Policy.

Google Fonts

Our website uses Google Fonts to display typography. When you visit our website, your browser loads fonts from Google's servers, which may collect your IP address and browser information. For more information, see Google's Privacy Policy.

6. Data Retention

We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected:

  • Contact form submissions: Retained for 2 years after your last contact with us, unless you request earlier deletion.
  • Email correspondence: Retained for 2 years after your last contact with us.
  • Cookie consent preferences: Stored in your browser's local storage until you clear it.

After the retention period, your data will be securely deleted or anonymized.

7. Your Rights

Under the GDPR, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:

  • Right of access (Art. 15): You can request a copy of the personal data we hold about you.
  • Right to rectification (Art. 16): You can request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.
  • Right to erasure (Art. 17): You can request deletion of your personal data ("right to be forgotten").
  • Right to restriction (Art. 18): You can request that we limit the processing of your data.
  • Right to data portability (Art. 20): You can request your data in a structured, commonly used format.
  • Right to object (Art. 21): You can object to processing based on legitimate interests.
  • Right to withdraw consent (Art. 7): You can withdraw your consent at any time, without affecting the lawfulness of processing before withdrawal.

8. How to Exercise Your Rights

To exercise any of your rights, please contact us at:

Email: hello@aeternaevents.com

We will respond to your request within 30 days. We may ask you to verify your identity before processing your request.

9. Right to Lodge a Complaint

If you believe that our processing of your personal data violates the GDPR or Italian data protection laws, you have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority.

The Italian supervisory authority is:

Garante per la protezione dei dati personali
Piazza Venezia 11, 00187 Roma
Website: www.garanteprivacy.it
Email: garante@gpdp.it

10. Data Security

We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. However, no method of transmission over the Internet or electronic storage is 100% secure.

11. International Data Transfers

Your personal data may be transferred to and processed in countries outside the European Economic Area (EEA), specifically the United States (through Formspree). Such transfers are made in compliance with GDPR requirements, including appropriate safeguards such as Standard Contractual Clauses.

12. Changes to This Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated "Last updated" date. We encourage you to review this policy periodically.

13. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our data practices, please contact us at:

Aeterna Events
Email: hello@aeternaevents.com

cookiePolicy.title: Cookie Policy
cookiePolicy.content:
This Cookie Policy explains how Aeterna Events ("we," "us," or "our") uses cookies and similar technologies when you visit our website at aeternaevents.com. This policy should be read alongside our Privacy Policy.

1. What Are Cookies?

Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile phone) when you visit a website. They help websites remember your preferences and improve your browsing experience. Cookies can be "session" cookies (which are deleted when you close your browser) or "persistent" cookies (which remain on your device for a set period or until you delete them).

2. Cookies We Use

Our website uses a minimal number of cookies. We do not use analytics cookies, advertising cookies, or tracking pixels. Below is a detailed list of the cookies used on our website:

Cookie NameTypePurposeDuration
aeterna_cookie_consentFirst-party, NecessaryStores your cookie consent preference so the banner doesn't appear on every visitPersistent (until cleared)

3. Third-Party Cookies

Our website loads fonts from Google Fonts. When you visit our site, your browser makes requests to Google's servers to load these fonts. Google may set cookies or collect information such as:

  • Your IP address
  • Browser type and version
  • Operating system
  • The page you visited

For detailed information about how Google processes this data, please see Google's Privacy Policy.

4. Cookies We Do NOT Use

To protect your privacy, we have chosen not to use:

  • Analytics cookies: We do not use Google Analytics or similar tracking tools.
  • Advertising cookies: We do not display advertisements or use retargeting.
  • Social media cookies: We do not embed social media plugins that track your activity.
  • Marketing pixels: We do not use Facebook Pixel, LinkedIn Insight Tag, or similar tracking technologies.

5. Local Storage

In addition to cookies, we use your browser's local storage to remember your cookie consent preference. Local storage is similar to cookies but allows for larger amounts of data to be stored. The data stored in local storage:

  • Is only accessible by our website
  • Is not sent to our servers
  • Remains until you clear your browser data

6. Managing Cookies

You have several options to manage cookies:

Browser Settings

Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings. You can typically:

  • View cookies stored on your device
  • Delete all or specific cookies
  • Block cookies from all or specific websites
  • Set your browser to notify you when a cookie is set

Here are links to cookie management instructions for popular browsers:

  • Google Chrome
  • Mozilla Firefox
  • Safari
  • Microsoft Edge

Clearing Local Storage

To clear your cookie consent preference, you can clear your browser's local storage. This is typically found in the same settings area as cookie management.

Impact of Disabling Cookies

Since our website uses very few cookies, disabling cookies should not significantly affect your experience. However, the cookie consent banner will appear on every visit if cookies are disabled.

7. Legal Basis

Under the EU ePrivacy Directive and GDPR:

  • Strictly necessary cookies (like our consent cookie) do not require consent as they are essential for the website to function.
  • Non-essential cookies require your consent before being set. We do not use non-essential cookies.

8. Changes to This Policy

We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated "Last updated" date. We encourage you to review this policy periodically.

9. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Cookie Policy or our use of cookies, please contact us at:

Aeterna Events
Email: hello@aeternaevents.com
